snippet.title: Elderly on mobility scooters endangered by obstacles
snippet.content: SIPPY Downs has a large number of elderly residents, many with mobility scooters as their sole means of transport. Therefore it is surprising Sunshine Coast Council installs incomplete infrastructure that leads to the elderly being endangered. Either end of Oxford Close in Sippy Downs provides great examples of this problem. Footpath crossings allow the elderly to cross University Way but lead to a footpath that stops 20 metres short of Oxford Close, forcing elderly to navigate onto the busy road. At the other end of Oxford Close, the footpath leading to Sippy Downs Dr has obstruction bars to be navigated around, forcing the elderly off the pathway onto bumpy, slippery, inclined grass. Council could easily fix these dangerous obstacles, preferring a 'no news is good news' approach. Unfortunately, this means an accident must occur before the council will support the elderly who use mobility scooters.
